episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics, including the anatomy of starfish, the optimal time for Dracula to drink blood, a historical event involving an angelic voice in London, and a bizarre incident involving a snake and a hawk attack. The hosts delve into these facts with humor and curiosity, exploring the science, history, and oddities behind each story.

facts.fact: My fact is that for years scientists thought Starfish had no heads. It now turns out they have no bodies.
My fact this week is that one of the best times for Dracula to suck your blood is while you are watching a Dracula movie.
Okay, my fact this week is that in 1554, thousands of people in London were convinced that they heard an angel talking to them from behind a wall and slagging off the Queen.
My fact this week is that this year, a woman was injured when she was attacked twice: once by a five-foot-long snake that fell from the sky, then immediately afterwards by the hawk that dropped it.
